titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Marion Edwards Park (1875-1960) was president of Bryn Mawr College from 1922 to 1942. Her father, William Edwards Park (d. 1894) was a Congregationalist minister in Gloversville, New York. His father was Edwards Amasa Park (1808-ca. 1888), a Congregationalist minister and professor of theology, philosophy, and Hebrew literature at Amherst College and the Andover Seminary. E.A. Park and his friend Bela Bates Edwards (1802-1852) co-founded Bibliotheca Sacra, a quarterly journal of theology. B.B. Edwards was Marion Edwards Park's maternal grandfather.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of the family of Marion Edwards Park. Materials include: correspondence of Bela Bates Edwards, Jerusha Billings Edwards, Edwards Amasa Park, William Edwards Park, Sarah Edwards Park, and Marion Edwards Park; memoirs, travel journals, and other writings by family members; childhood writings and drawings of Marion Edwards Park; an album commemorating Park's parents' 50th wedding anniversary; and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
